message.body: How are you, disappeared? I love the robin pecknold. Did you get the article I sent you?
Disappeared. Pretty much. I like how that song feels so rambly and off the cuff. Makes it sound very genuine to me.
All in all I'm doing alright. On a new medication that doesn't seem to be doing anything. So I'm just waiting. And then consulting with my docs about surgical
And in Kansas for the indeterminable future?
options. Because I can't let my life derail like this every fall. Its nice to be with family, though I wish I had the concentration to start doing something
productive. I started a book, piano, guitar, knitting, drawing. Just really hard to focus with an itchy brain.
Not sure how long I'll be in ks. Gonna start looking for some work here soon. Can't really go anywhere until I get some money saved up.
Are there any permanent fixes? Is that what youre seeing the surgeon for?
I am going to chicago this weekend to drop chuck off. that'll be good.
There are some theoretical fixes. One involves removing a portion of the intestine (chuck had this done still waiting to see if it was successful)
The others involve finding ways to drain bile directly out of the body- usually through some sort of permanent plastic port.
But the success rate percentages are all over the place. Especially because chuck and I seem to be the only young adults who have this condition.
Absolutely everyone else is pediatric. And they all usually reach the point where they have to have a transplant by the time they're 15.
Gotta love being the anomaly.
Rough. Maybe you'll be the anomalous case thT leads to a new discovery. Little recompense though.
No one seems interested in making discoveries for rare liver diseases. It's all about the flashier afflictions these days.
Fucking AIDS
Right. Anyway. Read the article pretty interesting stuff. And I obviously agree with a lot of it.
Where'd you find the new robin pecknold?
Just not sure what to do about it, you know? Get comfortable not knowing. Which I like that idea. But then where fo you fit in? Hm. Just rambling sorry
Pitchfork of course
Not knowing ideas? That's sad. Maybe inevitable but I'm not comfortable with that.
No no. I mean giving up the drive for knowing information in exchange for thinking ideas. Getting comfortable not knowing the answer often.
I prefer understanding I guess
When do you leave for foul fetid fuming foggy filthy philadelphia?
Wow. Don't have a date yet!
Sorry. I think that's a lyric from 1776.
Anyway. Thanks for asking about me. Its good to hear from people. I don't want to disappear entirely.
Sure sure. And of course! I feel for you. Keep me updated.
Likewise. I'll especially want to know how the adventure in the east unfolds.
